Articles.Content:
Stupid Industries presents to you the its Orbital OmniTug!

This orbital tug is equipped with both a regular dockingport and a dockingport Sr. so it can efficiently carry modules of different sizes. Multiple quantum struts are also integrated in the ship's hull to assure optimal stability during the transfer burns. It has main and retro engines to burn and brake in both directions. The ship has no crew and can therefore remain in orbit as long as you want without the need to worry about it's crew health. It gets its electrical supply from two RTGs and require no solar panels to operate. It has enough delta V to push 110 tons into Minmus orbit. The ship comes with HydroTech RCS Autopilot in option for those who have troubles with dockings! This tug also doesn't carry any nuclear engines, meaning it can be deorbited without the dear of radioactive damage to the environment!

Javascript is disabled. View full album

The tug comes with its own launcher and the core stage has enough fuel to deorbit itself after stable orbit has been achieved.

Total weight of 564,3 tons and 142 parts on the launchpad.

Spaceport download - Mediafire Download

Can be flown using MechJeb2 although it isn't included with the download. Instructions included in the attached ReadMe file.

Mods used: KW Rocketry v2.4, Quantum Struts, HydroTech RCS v0.5.3x (optional)

Edited June 22, 2013 by stupid_chris

Very nice. I'll be downloading this when I get home. I like building rockets, but would rather zoom around space, and I find I don't really have time for both. Are those Vesta engines?

Also, how do you get the imgur multi-photo interface to embed like that?

Nope, its the SPS (Service Propulsion System) engine from the KW Rocketry mod!

And for the albums, there was a post about it a while ago in the announcement forum!
